messages.original: A series of Israeli airstrikes targeted the Hermel region, northeastern Lebanon, a short time ago.
A series of Israeli airstrikes targeted the Hermel region, northeastern Lebanon, a short time ago.
The drone has entered Israeli airspace, flying northwest.
The Houthi drone impacted the Ramon Airport area again. It was not intercepted.
The Houthi drone impacted the Ramon Airport area again. It was not intercepted.
It seems to have fallen outside of the airport, impacting an open area. No casualties.

Russia is continuing to prepare for their next large-scale combined missile attack on Ukraine.
Another Tu-95MS strategic bomber redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, to be equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles. An IL-76MD military transport aircraft also landed at Engels-2 a short time ago. The cargo consists of Kh-101 missiles. 
Additionally, 1 Tu-160 redeployed from Engels-2 Airbase to Ukrainka Airbase, probably to be equipped with missiles.
As of now, at least 2 Tu-95s are known to be equipped with Kh-101 missiles at Olenya, as well as another 2 at Ukrainka. This is on top of 1 Tu-95 and 1 Tu-160 currently in the process of being equipped at Engels-2, and possibly another Tu-160 being equipped at Ukrainka.

Sentinel satellite imagery shows that the factory management building for the Zaporizhzhia Abrasive Plant was heavily damaged by Geran-2 drone strikes during the attacks on September 7.   Image credit: https://t.me/osint_alarm/223
Here are some close-up photos of the Abrasive Plant that was hit in Zaporizhzhia.
Here are some close-up photos of the Abrasive Plant that was hit in Zaporizhzhia.
A series of Israeli airstrikes targeted the Hermel region, northeastern Lebanon, a short time ago.
The IDF claimed that the airstrikes on northeastern Lebanon targeted Hezbollah camps, including ones used by their elite "Radwan" force.
Sirens are again sounding in southern Israel due to the threat of Houthi UAVs. This time in the area of the Rotem Industrial Zone.
Sirens are again sounding in southern Israel due to the threat of Houthi UAVs. This time in the area of the Rotem Industrial Zone.
The UAV is flying west to the Dimona Nuclear Research Centre.
The UAV is flying west to the Dimona Nuclear Research Centre.
Israeli media reports that the UAV fell outside Dimona.

This evening, Donetsk City and Makiivka came under a large-scale combined Ukrainian missile, rocket, and drone attack. Russian air defences were completely overwhelmed by the number of aerial targets, resulting in many of the cruise missiles getting through and impacting their targets. 
Among the targets hit was the "Topaz" plant, where at least 4 Storm Shadow missiles impacted one after another. Additionally, the Scientific Research Institute of Complex Automation was hit, likely by Ukrainian-produced "Peklo" long-range jet drones. The Donetsk Metalurgical plant was also hit by at least one UAV. 
Furthermore, HIMARS GMLRS launched from the vicinity of Kramatorsk targeted Makiivka, although it's unclear if any impacted. Their goal was likely to further saturate air defence for the jet-drones and storm shadows. 
Most UAVs and jet-drones were shot down by air defence units in Donetsk, Makiivka, and Yenakijeve, but a large portion of Storm Shadow cruise missiles launched by tactical aviation over Dnipropetrovsk Oblast got through. 
Ukrainian sources report that the targets were command posts used by the Russian Army, as well as the 41st Artillery Brigade, although this is currently unconfirmed.

Among the targets hit was the "Topaz" plant, where at least 4 Storm Shadow missiles impacted one after another. Additionally, the Scientific Research Institute of Complex Automation was hit, likely by Ukrainian-produced "Peklo" long-range jet drones. The Donetsk Metalurgical plant was also hit by at least one UAV. 
Furthermore, HIMARS GMLRS launched from the vicinity of Kramatorsk targeted Makiivka, although it's unclear if any impacted. Their goal was likely to further saturate air defence for the jet-drones and storm shadows. 
Most UAVs and jet-drones were shot down by air defence units in Donetsk, Makiivka, and Yenakijeve, but a large portion of Storm Shadow cruise missiles launched by tactical aviation over Dnipropetrovsk Oblast got through. 
Ukrainian sources report that the targets were command posts used by the Russian Army, as well as the 41st Artillery Brigade, although this is currently unconfirmed.

Last night, a Russian missile strike was carried out on the city of Druzhkivka, Donetsk Oblast. 1-2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were used, reportedly targeting an industrial zone (unconfirmed). Around 15 minutes later, another series of explosions were heard, likely from secondary detonations. 
Censorship regarding this event is unusually strong, so there is only one public video/photo showing the event, which is from a Russian channel.
The channel chat is temporarily locked for new users because of a bot raid. Next time 200 scam bots raid my chat, I'd appreciate it if someone DMed me so it doesn't get like this.
